description: Root meta-model: zones, schema, realities, aspirations, concepts. Implementation details in submodels.

hierarchy.description: Nodes can contain sub-BAMs. Zoom in for detail, zoom out for overview.

zones._description: Filesystem zones with explicit agent permissions. This defines where things live and what agents can do.

model.description: The model is THE truth. All structural changes require Change nodes.

source.description: Implementation code. Changes should go through Change nodes for traceability.

artifacts.description: Derived/generated files. Never edit directly - rebuild from source.

tools.description: Executable scripts and tests. Can invoke, should not modify without Change.

state.description: Runtime and UI state. Agents can read and write directly - this is transient.

docs.description: Documentation files. Should migrate into the model over time.
docs.notes: These files represent knowledge that should eventually live in the model itself.

Reality.description: A project/system with its own BAM model. The spawn point for agents entering this world.

agent_context_spec._note: Every Reality SHOULD have an agent_context. This is the spawn point.

Subsystem.description: A major component of a reality, can contain its own sub-BAM

Aspiration.description: A goal - human controlled, immutable by AI

Gap.description: An explicit delta between aspiration and reality. The work to be done.

Todo.description: A specific action that closes part of a gap

UIState.description: UI state stored in the model. Renderers read and write this node to change what the user sees.

View.description: A declarative UI view definition. A renderer materializes this into an on-screen layout.

Query.description: A declarative graph query over nodes/edges used by views. Kept intentionally small; evaluated by a renderer.

Action.description: A declarative mutation the renderer can apply to the model (allowlisted). Used for interaction bindings.

Proof.description: A structured record that a described reality and its implemented artifacts are aligned. Proof is stored in the model as data.

Audit.description: An actionable integrity check over the model. Audits are meant to be runnable procedures whose results can be recorded back into the model.

Check.description: A smaller, focused check (often part of an Audit).

Policy.description: A governing rule for how changes are proposed, executed, and accepted. Policies are enforced via audits/checks and agent_context principles.

Change.description: A proposed or executed change, explicitly tied to aspirations (why) and gaps (what delta), with required evidence.

Zone.description: A filesystem zone with explicit agent permissions. Zones define what an agent can do with files in different areas.

agent_permissions_spec.description: read=can view, write=can modify directly, propose_change=must use Change node, invoke=can execute

TARGETS.description: Reality is working towards another (long-term goal)

DERIVES_FROM.description: Aspiration derives from a more fundamental aspiration

BLOCKS.description: Gap blocks achievement of an aspiration

CLOSES.description: Todo closes (part of) a gap when completed

AUDITS.description: Audit targets a subject (usually a Reality or Subsystem)

GOVERNS.description: Policy governs the work (changes and/or todos).

ADDRESSES.description: A Change addresses a Gap (the explicit delta it reduces).

ADVANCES.description: A Change advances an Aspiration (the explicit why).

PRODUCES.description: A Change produces evidence artifacts (Proof/Audit/Check) recorded in the model.

nodes.label: Root
nodes.description: The Root meta-model. A model of all models. Your home. This node is self-referential - the Root models itself.

agent_context._spawn_point: YOU ARE HERE. This is Root - the root of all models.
agent_context.philosophy: Don't train the agent, train the world. You are waking up in a modeled world where everything is known. Read the model, understand it, work through it.

work_queue.why: Enforce model-only work so the model becomes the interface
work_queue.exit_criteria: The workflow is documented in the model and adopted as standard

work_queue.why: Make model edits safe + auditable by routing them through a controlled executor
work_queue.exit_criteria: A spawned change executor applies Change nodes via the Root Store gate and only commits when audits are green

work_queue.why: Enforce that all changes explicitly advance aspirations by closing gaps
work_queue.exit_criteria: Change/Policy/Audit pattern is in place and used for all work

work_queue.why: Stop repeatedly reading many JSON files by creating a fast query layer with safe writes and enforcement
work_queue.exit_criteria: Model Store indexes the model into SQLite, serves queries, applies Changes with validation, and records audit evidence back into the model

work_queue.why: Make reality verifiable by hash (drift detection)
work_queue.exit_criteria: All core Root files (under C:/seed) referenced by the model include verified SHA256 hashes

work_queue.why: Dogfood monitoring: Root should be a first-class monitored reality
work_queue.exit_criteria: Root appears in its own monitor with meaningful status

principles: ZONES FIRST: Check the 'zones' section to understand what you can do where. model/=propose_change, source/=propose_change, artifacts/=read-only, state/=read+write.
Default: do not directly edit files. Prefer activating modeled Actions and proposing Changes.
Interactive agents SHOULD be activate-only: request a spawned change executor for edits.
Moves are bundle-closure operations: respect node.mobility and move attached nodes together (Audit<->Check via HAS_CHECK, parent/child via CONTAINS).
Do not manually cut/paste nodes across files; use root_store.move_nodes_to_file and verify audit-root-store-attachment-closure.
Every change MUST be represented as a Change node that (a) ADDRESSES a Gap and (b) ADVANCES at least one Aspiration, with required evidence recorded back into the model
Gaps are explicit - find them in nodes with type=Gap
Todos CLOSE gaps - that's their purpose
Aspirations are human-controlled, immutable by AI
When in doubt, make the implicit explicit in the model

how_to_work.1_orient: Find this agent_context in the Reality node. You are here.
how_to_work.2_understand: Read focus gap. Read aspirations it blocks. Understand the delta.
how_to_work.3_act: Pick highest priority todo from work_queue that CLOSES the focus gap.
how_to_work.4_update: After work, update model: mark todos done, update gap status, add discoveries.
how_to_work.5_verify: Model must reflect truth. If you changed anything, model must show it.

model._note: This is a self-reference. Root contains its own model.

nodes.label: Root Model Store
nodes.description: Local-first model backend: a uniform interface over many model locations (multiple JSON files, submodels, and eventually many repos/worlds). Maintains a derived SQLite index/cache for fast query/search/reverse lookups, records provenance for writeback, and provides safe writes with governance enforcement (Change gate, validation, audits, and model-recorded evidence).

agent_context._note: The SQLite DB is derived state and must be reproducible from the model JSON files.

work_queue.why: Enable fast query + safe writes + enforcement for Root
work_queue.exit_criteria: Store can load root model + refs, index into SQLite, answer queries, apply Change patches with validation, and run/record audits

work_queue.why: Make the store a stable interface over many model locations
work_queue.exit_criteria: A Model Registry reality exists and is referenced by the store; models can be discovered without knowing file paths

work_queue.why: Enable moving most content out of seed/model/sketch.json safely
work_queue.exit_criteria: Audit/check evidence and Change application write back to the correct provenance file, not only the root entry file

nodes.label: Spawnie
nodes.description: Workflow orchestrator for CLI agents. First system fully embracing the Root philosophy.

agent_context._note: This is a portal node. Prefer spawning into Spawnie by loading its referenced model and using its internal Reality spawn point.

work_queue.why: Make Spawnie instantly understandable from Root without loading another file
work_queue.exit_criteria: Root embeds a meaningful Spawnie summary and/or key nodes

nodes.label: Store
nodes.description: Core model store components: loader/merger, SQLite index, query engine, safe writer, enforcement, watcher, audit runner, API.

save.notes: Node-defined save behavior. Spawnie workflow seed-save-node should interpret this if present; otherwise fall back to a default save routine.

nodes.label: BAM
nodes.description: Tool for generating models of complex systems

agent_context._note: BAM is not yet fully modeled here; this is a minimal spawn point for future work.

work_queue.why: Build the BAM tool so BAMs can be created/maintained
work_queue.exit_criteria: BAM tool exists and is itself modeled with proofs

nodes.label: BAM Test Projects
nodes.description: Smaller projects to validate the model-as-workspace concept.

agent_context._note: Minimal spawn point to create and model test projects.

work_queue.why: Validate BAM + modeling workflows on small projects
work_queue.exit_criteria: Multiple test projects are modeled and used regularly

nodes.label: 4. REALITY: Browser Renderer
nodes.description: A browser-based renderer that watches the Root model and renders declarative views as an interactive graph. Polls the model for changes and updates visualization in real-time. Your screen IS this reality - model changes become visual truth.

agent_context._note: The renderer IS the screen. Claude modifies model Ã¢â€ â€™ screen updates. This is the real-time visualization reality.

work_queue.why: Full loop: modelÃ¢â€ â€™screenÃ¢â€ â€™interactionÃ¢â€ â€™model
work_queue.exit_criteria: User clicks on screen Ã¢â€ â€™ model updates Ã¢â€ â€™ screen reflects change

mod-ui-renderer.label: Renderer (index.html)
mod-ui-renderer.description: Browser-based graph visualization using vis.js. Polls model JSON, renders nodes/edges as interactive graph, shows node details on click.

mod-ui-server.label: Dev Server (server.py)
mod-ui-server.description: Simple HTTP server for local development. Serves model JSON with CORS headers. Port 8420.

mod-ui-screenshot.label: Screenshot Tool (screenshot.py)
mod-ui-screenshot.description: Captures user's screen so Claude can see what they see. The feedback loop: user's reality becomes Claude's input. Run with 'python ui/screenshot.py' to save screenshot.png.

action-capture-screenshot.label: Capture Screenshot
action-capture-screenshot.description: Claude captures the user's screen to see their reality. Saves to ui/screenshot.png which Claude can then read.

nodes.label: Model Registry
nodes.description: A registry of model locations (local paths, repos, URLs) that the Root Model Store can index into one logical graph. This is the backbone for a world where Seed is only one of many referenced nodes.

agent_context._note: Backbone node: once this exists, most users should not need to know file paths to find worlds.

work_queue.why: Turn distributed model locations into a discoverable graph
work_queue.exit_criteria: Registry captures at least local-file locations and can be indexed by the store

nodes.label: UI
nodes.description: Root's UI subsystem (model-driven visualization + renderer). This is the primary navigation mountpoint for UI work; the UI model lives where the UI should materialize: C:/seed/src/ui/model/sketch.json.

nodes.label: Core
nodes.description: Root's core implementation - pulse, status, monitoring, verification

nodes.label: Single Source of Truth
nodes.description: The model is THE truth. Not a reflection of truth, not documentation of truth - the actual truth. All changes flow through the model. Reality follows.

nodes.label: Model Contains Reality
nodes.description: The model doesn't describe reality - it contains it. Source references with hashes embed actual artifacts. The model is not documentation of the world, it IS the world.

nodes.label: Model Everything
nodes.description: All systems the user works with should be modeled in seed. Every project, every tool, every workflow. The model is the universal interface to all realities.

nodes.label: Agent World Principle
nodes.description:
CORE PRINCIPLE FOR ALL AGENTS:

The world agents live in consists ONLY of:
1. The MODEL (source of truth, shared state)
2. Other AGENTS (who also only see model + agents)

The user is the ONLY entity that exists outside this world.

Implications:
- All communication happens through the model
- All state is model state
- An "always-on controller" is just an agent
- No special infrastructure needed - just model + agents
- To affect reality, modify the model
- To know reality, read the model

This is the Seed philosophy: Model-first, model-only for agents.

nodes.label: UI Command
nodes.description: Command node for Claude to control the UI
